trustfund:
TF039175-JORDAN - GOVERNMENT COMPUTER
            CAPACITY BUILDING IMPROVEMENT,TF026127-PHRD-FIRST PUBLIC SECTOR REFORM LOAN

abstracts.cdata!:
This programmatic loan is the first in a
            planned series of three Public Sector Loans (PSRLs). The
            program will support Jordan by providing fast-disbursing
            extenral financing to meet anticipated gaps originating from
            its fiscal needs, while supporting fundamental structural
            changes in its core public sector. The loan aims to
            strengthen public institutional capacity and the quality of
            public services; key objectives are to strengthen private
            investment, diversify the economy, achieve closer
            integration with the global economy, strengthen the
            country's human capital base, and ensure better access
            to services for citizens particularly the poor. By providing
            fiscal support, the loan would reduce the risks of delays
            and interruption in a difficult and lengthy process which is
            being carried out in an inherently shock-prone economic and
            political environment. It would improve the level and
            quality of public services to better position Jordan to
            attract foreign and domestic investment and to improve
            services for all citizens. This comes out clearly from the
            importance given to regulatory reform and to judicial
            reform. In both cases the purpose is to improve the
            stability and predictability of the business environment.
            The loan would also further the Government's economic
            strategy, which seeks to benefit from the increasing forces
            of globalization by positioning Jordan as an efficient
            platform for more human resource-intensive exports of goods
            and service.
